The chunk consists of two methods (`newCreateSider` and `newCreateEntryScale`) in the `AppShell` class that are used to create and configure specific graphical user interface (GUI) components—sliders and entry scales—for an application. These methods are part of a larger set of utility functions designed to streamline the creation and management of UI elements within the application framework, leveraging widget-specific classes (`Slider.Slider` and `EntryScale.EntryScale`) while handling common setup tasks such as packing, help binding, and variable tracking.

def newCreateSider(self, parent, category, text,
                       help = '', command = None,
                       side = tk.LEFT, fill = tk.X, expand = 0, **kw):
        # Create the widget
        widget = self.createWidget(parent, category, text,
                                   Slider.Slider,
                                   help, command, side, fill, expand, kw)
        return widget

    def newCreateEntryScale(self, parent, category, text,
                            help = '', command = None,
                            side = tk.LEFT, fill = tk.X, expand = 0, **kw):
        # Create the widget
        widget = self.createWidget(parent, category, text,
                                   EntryScale.EntryScale,
                                   help, command, side, fill, expand, kw)
        return widget
